lead_paragraph: Prosecutors said that Muhammad Dakhlalla had agreed to accompany his fiancée, Jaelyn Young, who had envisioned joining the Islamic State.

headline.print_headline: 8-Year Term for a Fiancé Who Agreed to Join ISIS
headline.main: Mississippi Man Sentenced to 8 Years for Planning to Join ISIS

snippet: Prosecutors said that Muhammad Dakhlalla had agreed to accompany his fiancée, Jaelyn Young, who had envisioned joining the Islamic State....
abstract: Judge Sharion Aycock of United States District Court in Starkville, Miss, sentences Muhammad Dakhlalla to eight years in prison on federal terrorism charges; Mississippi man and his fiance Jaelyn Young had been arrested in August 2015 after contacting undercover federal agents seeking travel help to Syria in order to join Islamic State.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
